original_text:
**INSTITUTION
CRITICAL CARE MEDICINE
ATTENDING PHYSICIAN PROGRESS NOTE
PATIENT NAME :
**NAME[AAA , BBB M]
ACCOUNT # :
**ID-NUM
**ROOM
ATTENDING PHYSICIAN :
**NAME[YYY M ZZZ]
ADMISSION DATE :
**DATE[Jul 12 2007]
EVALUATION DATE :
**DATE[Jul 27 07]
I personally managed Mr. **NAME[AAA] in the ICU .
He is an **AGE[in 80s]- year - old man with aspiration , ARDS , respiratory failure , pneumonia , now growing out
Streptococcus viridans .
He is on adequate antibiotics in the form of Zosyn .
He continues to show poor cardiac function , somewhat improved today on Levophed to keep his blood pressure up .
His chest x-ray shows continued bilateral aspiration .
The echocardiogram of his heart does not show any evidence of anything substantially new .
His lactate level is 2 indicating poor perfusion from poor cardiac output combined with poor pulmonary function .
His blood pressure is 158/81 with a heart rate of 82 .
He is now on propofol .
He passes air reasonably well over both sides of his chest with some distant sounds .
Heart sounds are distant .
His belly is soft with positive bowel sounds .
His condition continues to be poor .
His family is now considering their options in terms of possibility of withdrawal of life support on the basis of poor outcome from this major medical situation .
Critical care time 30 minutes .
___________________________________
**NAME[WWW M. XXX] , M.D.
Dictator :
**NAME[WWW M. XXX] , M.D.
**INITIALS
D :
**DATE[Jul 27 2007] 19:46:16
T :
**DATE[Jul 27 2007] 19:52:47

-**NAME[XXX , VVV M]. ***

**DATE[Aug 04 2007] 08:50:41 PM
